channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Remembering Ted Olson, a titan of the law
item.description: Ted Olson, the Bush-era solicitor general, has died at age 84. He was a towering figure in the legal profession who argued 65 cases at the Supreme Court as solicitor general and as a private lawyer.
item.content:encoded:
Ted Olson, the Bush-era solicitor general, has died at age 84. He was a towering figure in the legal profession who argued 65 cases at the Supreme Court as solicitor general and as a private lawyer.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: 'I was shocked': Lawmakers react to Gaetz pick to be Trump's attorney general
item.description: Trump intends to nominate Rep. Matt Gaetz as attorney general and former Democratic Rep. Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligence, surprising many lawmakers who will have to confirm them.
item.content:encoded:
Trump intends to nominate Rep. Matt Gaetz as attorney general and former Democratic Rep. Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligence, surprising many lawmakers who will have to confirm them.

(Image credit: Allison Bailey)
item.dc:creator: Lexie Schapitl

item.title: University of Rochester investigates 'Wanted' posters accusing staff of Gaza war crimes
item.description: The posters, which appeared across campus, accuse university faculty of being complicit in war crimes against Palestinians in Gaza. The university president condemned the posters as antisemitic.
item.content:encoded:
The posters, which appeared across campus, accuse university faculty of being complicit in war crimes against Palestinians in Gaza. The university president condemned the posters as antisemitic.

(Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Russia and North Korea Vow to Defend One Another
item.description: North Korea and Russia each ratified a mutual defense treaty within days of each other. The pact means the countries will defend one another if attacked. And some say it may mean more involvement by North Korea in the war between Russia and Ukraine. We hear about the ramifications from our correspondent in Seoul.
item.content:encoded: North Korea and Russia each ratified a mutual defense treaty within days of each other. The pact means the countries will defend one another if attacked. And some say it may mean more involvement by North Korea in the war between Russia and Ukraine. We hear about the ramifications from our correspondent in Seoul.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Fed up with high prices? Here's where things stand with inflation
item.description: Inflation remains substantially lower than it did during its 2022 peak — but Americans are still frustrated with high prices.
item.content:encoded:
Inflation remains substantially lower than it did during its 2022 peak — but Americans are still frustrated with high prices.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: Trump announces Matt Gaetz as attorney general pick
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump announced his pick for one of the biggest jobs in his new administration: attorney general. And for that job, Trump has chosen Florida Congressman Matt Gaetz.
item.content:encoded: President-elect Donald Trump announced his pick for one of the biggest jobs in his new administration: attorney general. And for that job, Trump has chosen Florida Congressman Matt Gaetz.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Shaboozey's 'A Bar Song (Tipsy)' hits another pop chart milestone
item.description: "A Bar Song (Tipsy)" added another week atop the chart, making it the longest-running No. 1 of the decade. In two more weeks, it could tie the all-time record, but a seasonal juggernaut approaches.
item.content:encoded:
"A Bar Song (Tipsy)" added another week atop the chart, making it the longest-running No. 1 of the decade. In two more weeks, it could tie the all-time record, but a seasonal juggernaut approaches.

(Image credit: Matt Winkelmeyer)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thompson

item.title: Trump names former Rep. Tulsi Gabbard for director of national intelligence
item.description: The former Democratic congresswoman has shifted her political allegiance in recent years, going from a candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2020 to a stalwart Trump supporter.
item.content:encoded:
The former Democratic congresswoman has shifted her political allegiance in recent years, going from a candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2020 to a stalwart Trump supporter.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Trump to nominate Florida's Matt Gaetz to be attorney general
item.description: In a post on Truth Social announcing the nomination of Gaetz, Trump said: "Few issues in America are more important than ending the partisan Weaponization of our Justice System." Gaetz said he would resign from the U.S. House of Representatives, effective immediately.
item.content:encoded:
In a post on Truth Social announcing the nomination of Gaetz, Trump said: "Few issues in America are more important than ending the partisan Weaponization of our Justice System." Gaetz said he would resign from the U.S. House of Representatives, effective immediately.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Outside: vinyl siding. Inside: a bear
item.description: In Pittsburgh, entire houses have been converted into individual art installations filled with unusual objects. A new house is now open.
item.content:encoded:
In Pittsburgh, entire houses have been converted into individual art installations filled with unusual objects. A new house is now open.

(Image credit: Rebecca Kiger)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Vanasco
